meanings.definition: Capable of being secured or made safe.
meanings.sent1: The lock on the door made the house securable.
meanings.sent2: She made sure the valuable items were securable in the safe.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the nut was securable in its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was as securable as a fortress.
meanings.sent5: The securable feeling of warmth from the fireplace was comforting.

meanings.definition: Able to be obtained or acquired.
meanings.sent1: The rare stamp was securable at the antique shop.
meanings.sent2: The necessary documents for the job were securable online.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a unicorn as a pet seemed securable in his dreams.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness was as securable as a treasure chest full of gold.
meanings.sent5: The securable knowledge from the library helped him with his research.

meanings.definition: Able to be protected or defended.
meanings.sent1: The strong walls made the castle securable from attacks.
meanings.sent2: The password provided a securable barrier to the account.
meanings.sent3: The cat believed its toy mouse was securable from the dog.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was as securable as a shield against doubts.
meanings.sent5: The securable boundaries set by the teacher maintained order in the classroom.
